d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The rearward positioned cabin, rising belt-line and dynamic character lines express energy and movement.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Styling and poise

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The all-new Mazda3 Fastback is inspired by our ‘KODO – Soul of Motion’ design theme. The lower, wider KODO stance conveys strength.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Striking silhouette

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The powerful front end gives the impression of purpose and intent. The front grille integrates effortlessly with the front lights and air intake, streamlining airflow and enhancing the car’s aerodynamic performance.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Pit-lane panache

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: In November we invited our fans and customers to test out the all-new Mazda3 on the Silverstone race track.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: All-new Mazda3 Silverstone Track Day

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: Johnny Vaughan takes on the all-new Mazda3
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Creating Sparks
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Body:
In a bid to demonstrate the all-new Mazda3's exceptional driving dynamics and to promote its Lane Departure Warning System, Mazda's creative team built a life-size Steady Hand game on a racing circuit in Spain (the idea being that the driver gets a mild shock if he strays off course).

We then asked Johnny Vaughan to race against a professional driver to see who could complete the circuit the fastest, and - as you can see from our film - much fun ensued.

There will be more behind-the-scenes footage and outtakes over the coming weeks.

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: UK launch on the twists and turns of Silverstone
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: All-new Mazda3 meets F1
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Body:
With the all-new Mazda3 being such a fun car to drive, Mazda UK decided it was only appropriate to holds its launch event at the fabled British F1 Grand Prix circuit.

Throughout the day, the much-anticipated new model was put through its paces by trained drivers as they pitted the SKYACTIV-G model against a range of cars, which included BMW 1-Series 114i, Ford Focus 1.0 Ecoboost and Audi A3 1.4 TFSI over scores of laps.

Feedback from the day ranged from “all-new Mazda3 in a league of its own” through “stunning interior design” and “the star (all-new Mazda3) is the reasonably priced car”.

To learn more about the all-new Mazda3, which goes on sale in 3 January 2014, please visit our showroom or request your own test drive.

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: Mazda’s latest bestseller leaves a lasting impression on Auto Express’ Test Team
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: High scores for Mazda3
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Body:
Automotive journalists are a notoriously tough audience to impress, which is why there were collective smiles at Mazda when Auto Express announced the findings from its recent review of the all-new Mazda 3.

Not only did Mazda’s latest model release achieve an impressive overall score of 4.3 out of 5 stars, it received real praise with comments including “it offers sleek styling andpromises strong performance and engaging driving dynamics”.

In the five categories the car was measured on, the all-new Mazda3 scored highest in driving (with a near-perfect five stars). The reviewer finding that “it’s clear that the Mazda has been designed with keen drivers in mind” and “the Mazda3 has agile handling, strong grip and excellent body control”.

To read the Auto Express’ Test Team review in full, which was published on Dec 10, please click here

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: consectetur adipiscing elit.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: The All-New Mazda3

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: Lorem ipsum dolor
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: All-New Mazda3 London Reveal Event

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: Mazda’s latest new model sets the standard
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: FIVE-STAR SAFETY
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Body:
A car’s ability to keep its passengers safe is an important criteria of any new car purchase, which is why Mazda is so pleased to announce that the all-new Mazda3 was recently awarded a five-star safety rating by Euro NCAP*.

The new version of Mazda’s all-time bestseller - which goes on sale in January 2014 - easily passed the Euro NCAP tests, achieving outstanding marks in all four test categories. In fact, it did so well that – at the time of writing – it is the safest compact car to be tested by Euro NCAP thus far in 2013.

For more detail on the five-star rating, please click here. To learn more about the all-new Mazda3 range, please click here.

*Euro NCAP = European New Car Assessment Programme, an independent agency awarding auto safety ratings since 1997

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Kodo Design

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The expressive bodylines flow smoothly into the powerful rear quarters, adding to the sense of anticipation at the exciting driving experiences that lie ahead.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Expression and anticipation

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The low stance combined with a sloping roof line of the, large wheel arches and dynamic character lines of the Fastback create an expression of energy and movement meaning all-new Mazda3 will stand out from the crowd even on the busiest of roads.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Dynamic stance

d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Intro: The signature Mazda face features the distinctive winged grille that connects seamlessly with the sleek headlights, adding to the dynamic presence of all-new Mazda3.
d2p1:ContentItem.d2p1:Name: Signature styling
